titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the David Wolf Collection of American Musical Theater
Wolf (David) Collection of American Musical Theater
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday April 25, 2019 at 03:09

did.unittitle: David Wolf Collection of American Musical Theater

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Boxes 11-22 (audiocassettes): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and in some instances minimal organization in 2005. Additional organization and rehousing was conducted in 2014.

As a rule, descriptive information found in the Collection Contents section is drawn in large part from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

bioghist.head: David Wolf (1947-2005)
bioghist.p: David Wolf was a member of the New York performing arts community. He worked for the stage director Harold Prince as a stage manager and assistant casting director for musical theater productions including Company , Follies , and A Little Night Music in the early 1970s; as a writer for the children's television series, The Unicorn Tales , for which he won an Emmy Award in 1978; and in other capacities in the entertainment industry. From childhood he was a collector of musical theater recordings and memorabilia, an interest that continued throughout his life.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of stage and film scripts and musical theater librettos, including early versions of Stephen Sondheim's unproduced Saturday Night (circa 1954) through Assassins (1990), as well as early versions of Harold Prince shows beginning with Cabaret (1966); audio recordings of musical theater and film productions, performances by individual singers, and interviews and presentations by directors, composers and performers; and scrapbooks containing newspaper clippings, photographs, production programs, and other material relating to theater and film productions including Fiddler on the Roof , Cabaret , and A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes annotated and unannotated mimeographed and photocopied typescript librettos and scripts from musical theater, stage, and film productions.

arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically within three categories: Musicals, Composer/Singer, and Interviews.
